Definition: In this task, you will read a passage and answer a question based on your understanding of the events inferred from the passage. Among the entities mentioned in the passage, try to find the best entity that is most likely to fill in the blank "_". Then, classify the answers based on the options given.

Positive Examples.input:
For four years we have waited expectantly for the pitter patter of tiny paws. Soon, that wait could finally be over. Tian Tian, the UK's only female giant panda, has conceived and could give birth to a cub as early as August. However Edinburgh Zoo, where the pandas live, have warned people 'not to get too excited' as the process is 'extremely complex'. Moreover, on the two previous occasions keepers inseminated Tian Tian - whose name means 'Sweetie' - she has failed to produce a panda cub. She was artificially inseminated again in March this year, but keepers at the zoo say implantation - when a fertilised egg attaches to the uterus - has not yet occurred.Tian Tian has conceived and could give birth to a cub as early as AugustShe has been inseminated twice before but so far failed to produce a cubTian Tian and Yang Guang arrived in 2011 from China to great fanfareOn loan at £600k a year, became first giant pandas to live in UK for 17 years 
 Questions:Under the terms of the agreement any cubs will return to _ at the age of two, the age at which they would normally leave their mother in the wild. (A) Tian Tian (B) UK (C) Edinburgh Zoo (D) Sweetie (E) Yang Guang (F) China
Positive Examples.explanation: This is a good example. Based on the passage, any cubs will return to China at the age of two

Positive Examples.input:
Manchester United did make an ambitious bid to sign Barcelona forward Neymar in the summer, according to the Brazil international's father. It has been widely reported that Louis van Gaal attempted to bring the 23-year-old to Old Trafford in the final weeks of the transfer window, with Neymar admitting that there had been discussions about a possible switch. Manchester United's desperate scramble for new striker after allowing Robin van Persie, Radamel Falcao and Javier Hernandez to all leave the club, led to them being linked with a host of players, including Bayern Munich forward Thomas Muller. United eventually parted with £36million for French teenager Anthony Martial from Monaco but, according to Neymar's father Neymar da Silva Santos, only after they had failed with a bid to lure his son away from the Nou Camp.Manchester United were widely reported to have bid for Neymar in summerThe player's father has confirmed that the Old Trafford club did make offerThe Brazil international is ready to open talks over a new deal at Barcelona 
 Questions:'_'s offer came to Barça and they told us they won't sell,' Neymar Snr is quoted as saying by Brazilian newspaper Globo. (A) Manchester United (B) Barcelona (C) Neymar (D) Brazil (E) Louis van Gaal (F) Old Trafford (G) Robin van Persie (H) Radamel Falcao (I) Javier Hernandez (J) Bayern Munich (K) Thomas Muller (L) French (M) Anthony Martial (N) Monaco (O) Neymar da Silva Santos (P) Nou Camp
Positive Examples.explanation: Based on the given passage, option (A) is correct.

Instances.input:
Santa could face his easiest Christmas yet after the nicest and naughtiest names in the UK were revealed. Children named Anna, Millie, Harry and Ryan are most likely to be top of the 'nice list' this year while youngsters called Joseph, Leah, Eleanor and James could all face a lump of coal in their stockings, according to a survey by business School Stickers. But this list is not set in stone and there is still time for the worst-behaved children to improve their Christmas chances by being good all December. School Stickers produces a range of products designed to reward good behaviour at school and its survey of 70,000 pupils nationwide revealed Anna, Courtney, Millie, Mia and Grace are the names of the girls most-likely to be good while the best boys are Harry, Ryan, Ethan, Lewis and Ben.School Stickers has identified the best and worst behaved names in UKAnna, Millie, Harry and Ryan all among the 'nicest' children on Santa's listBut Joseph, Leah, Abigail and James could be disappointed at ChristmasThe business surveyed 70,000 children nationwide 
 Questions:'There are many children called Leah and Joseph who are perfect little angels, just as there are many called _ and Anna who Santa is watching!. (A) Santa (B) UK (C) Anna (D) Millie (E) Harry (F) Ryan (G) Joseph (H) Leah (I) Eleanor (J) James (K) School Stickers (L) Courtney (M) Mia (N) Grace (O) Ethan (P) Lewis (Q) Ben (R) Santa's (S) Abigail

Manchester United legend Gary Pallister believes Chris Smalling has what it takes to lead club and country after seeing a dramatic improvement this season from the centre back. Smalling has shone under United boss Louis van Gaal this season, with the 25-year-old having emerged as the Dutchman's first-choice defender due to his commanding presence. The Red Devils have the joint-third best defensive record in the Premier League this campaign - having conceded just eight goals so far. And Pallister believes that Smalling's contribution towards this could be replicated on a grander scale for England too. 'It's very feasible as he is United's vice-captain so as long as the manager keeps getting his name right he'll be alright,' he said of the 25-year-old to 888sport.Chris Smalling has improved massively as a defender this seasonManchester United have conceded just eight league goals this term so farUnited great Gary Pallister also thinks Daley Blind can emulate Steve Bruce 
 Questions:At United Smalling has formed an unfamiliar yet solid defensive partnership with _ this season. (A) Manchester United (B) Gary Pallister (C) Chris Smalling (D) Smalling (E) United (F) Louis van Gaal (G) Dutchman (H) Red Devils (I) Premier League (J) Pallister (K) England (L) Daley Blind (M) Steve Bruce

(CNN) New battleground state polls released Monday find Hillary Clinton with the advantage in New Hampshire and Pennsylvania with hours to go before Election Day. New Hampshire The CNN polling average in New Hampshire now has Clinton with a 3-point edge (44% to 41%) over Republican opponent Donald Trump following a new poll's released Sunday showing the Democratic presidential nominee with an 11-point lead. The poll from the University of New Hampshire, released Monday, found Clinton ahead of Trump 49% to 38%. Libertarian Gary Johnson registered 6% in the poll, and Green Party candidate Jill Stein drew 1%. Four percent said they remain undecided.Hillary Clinton has a large lead in New Hampshire with a day to go before the 2016 electionClinton also leads in Pennsylvania, powered by an advantage in the southeast 
 Questions:According to the poll, _ and Clinton "will end the election cycle historically unpopular among New Hampshire voters," with both candidates registering negative favorability ratings: -14% for Clinton, and -36% for Trump. (A) CNN (B) Hillary Clinton (C) New Hampshire (D) Pennsylvania (E) Election Day (F) Clinton (G) Republican (H) Donald Trump (I) Democratic (J) University of New Hampshire (K) Libertarian (L) Gary Johnson (M) Green Party (N) Jill Stein
